snippet: Rafael Nadal, who has not played a match since June 28 at Wimbledon, withdrew from the Olympics and two Open warm-up events because of chronic knee problems.
abstract: Rafael Nadal withdraws from the United States Open because of chronic knee problems that forced him out of the Olympics and two warm-up tournaments for the Open.
lead_paragraph: Rafael Nadal, who has not played a match since June 28 at Wimbledon, withdrew from the Olympics and two Open warm-up events because of chronic knee problems.

headline.seo: Nadal, Still Recovering From Knee Problems, Will Miss United States Open
headline.main: Still Recovering From Knee Problems, Nadal Will Miss United States Open
headline.print_headline: Knee Problems to Keep Nadal Out of U.S. Open
